message.content:
Research ExtendScript and CEP (Common Extensibility Platform) for Adobe Premiere Pro:

1. Does ExtendScript provide razor tool or clip splitting functionality?
2. What timeline editing APIs are available in ExtendScript for Premiere Pro?
3. How to use app.project.activeSequence and related APIs for cutting/splitting clips?
4. Is CEP still supported in Premiere Pro 2024/2025?
5. What are the differences between CEP and UXP for Premiere Pro development?

Search for code examples and documentation on how to programmatically cut/split clips in Premiere Pro using ExtendScript.

input.query: ExtendScript Premiere Pro razor tool clip splitting API 2024
Premiere Pro ExtendScript app.project.activeSequence timeline editing API documentation
Adobe CEP vs UXP Premiere Pro 2024 2025 support deprecation

Based on the search results, here's what I found about ExtendScript and the Premiere Pro razor tool/clip splitting API:

## Key Findings

### No Direct "Cut" or "Razor" Function in ExtendScript API

"There's no such thing as a 'cut', in the API. Instead, you would adjust the duration of the existing trackItem, then insert a new trackItem, representing the remaining portion of the original trackItem."

### QE DOM Razor Method (Unsupported)

There's no cut function in the ExtendScript API. The QE DOM has a `razor(string, bool, bool)` method on sequence and track objects, but it's been reported to be difficult to get working.(no content)One user found success by calling the RAZOR method through the QE (Quality Engineering) library. Sample code involves enabling QE with `app.enableQE()`, getting the active QE sequence via `qe.project.getActiveSequence()`, and using the player time in timecode format like "00:00:03:38".(no content)You can accomplish clip splitting without using the unsupported, unrecommended QE DOM.

### Workaround Approach

As a workaround, you can use `overwriteClip()` with one-frame media and then delete that new media immediately, which will leave you with two desired cut clips, but with a one-frame gap.

### UXP Status (Current)

There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool. In Premiere Pro, all markers and metadata associated with trackItems are actually attached to the backing projectItem.

### ExtendScript Future

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so through September 2026.(no content)No further changes or improvements to Premiere Pro's ExtendScript API are planned or scheduled. Any such changes will be reconsidered once Premiere Pro moves to UXP-based extensibility.

### Resources

- The PProPanel example panel includes documentation and sample code: https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/tree/master/PProPanel. The ExtendScript API docs are available at https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about ExtendScript and the Premiere Pro razor tool/clip splitting API:

## Key Findings

### No Direct "Cut" or "Razor" Function in ExtendScript API

"There's no such thing as a 'cut', in the API. Instead, you would adjust the duration of the existing trackItem, then insert a new trackItem, representing the remaining portion of the original trackItem."

### QE DOM Razor Method (Unsupported)

There's no cut function in the ExtendScript API. The QE DOM has a `razor(string, bool, bool)` method on sequence and track objects, but it's been reported to be difficult to get working.(no content)One user found success by calling the RAZOR method through the QE (Quality Engineering) library. Sample code involves enabling QE with `app.enableQE()`, getting the active QE sequence via `qe.project.getActiveSequence()`, and using the player time in timecode format like "00:00:03:38".(no content)You can accomplish clip splitting without using the unsupported, unrecommended QE DOM.

### Workaround Approach

As a workaround, you can use `overwriteClip()` with one-frame media and then delete that new media immediately, which will leave you with two desired cut clips, but with a one-frame gap.

### UXP Status (Current)

There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool. In Premiere Pro, all markers and metadata associated with trackItems are actually attached to the backing projectItem.

### ExtendScript Future

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so through September 2026.(no content)No further changes or improvements to Premiere Pro's ExtendScript API are planned or scheduled. Web search results for query: "Adobe CEP vs UXP Premiere Pro 2024 2025 support deprecation"

Links: [{"title":"Updates for Creative Cloud Desktop Extensibility | by Padma Krishnamoorthy | Adobe Tech Blog | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/adobetech/updates-for-creative-cloud-desktop-extensibility-0dd5c663563e"},{"title":"Solved: is CEP still supported? - Adobe Product Community - 14093791","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/is-cep-still-supported/td-p/14093791"},{"title":"Solved: UXP current status for premiere? - Adobe Product Community - 12121301","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/uxp-current-status-for-premiere/td-p/12121301"},{"title":"Solved: Premiere Pro Extensions - To UXP or not to UXP - Adobe Product Community - 11326933","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/premiere-pro-extensions-to-uxp-or-not-to-uxp/td-p/11326933"},{"title":"Solved: Full UXP support ETA - Adobe Product Community - 15352929","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/full-uxp-support-eta/td-p/15352929"},{"title":"Why Migrating to Adobe UXP Now Is Critical | by Andrew Zaikin | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@azaikin/migration-from-adobe-cep-to-uxp-57ef6b629386"},{"title":"Extendscript hit the ground running | Pixel-Nexus","url":"https://pixel-nexus.com/extendscript_hit_the_ground_running.html"},{"title":"Premiere Pro UXP Beta — Blog | Hyper Brew","url":"https://hyperbrew.co/blog/premiere-pro-uxp-beta/"},{"title":"Solved: what happened to adobe/Cep/ directory to install e... - Adobe Product Community - 12576895","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/exchange-discussions/what-happened-to-adobe-cep-directory-to-install-extensions/td-p/12576895"},{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"}]

Based on my search, here's what I found about Adobe CEP vs UXP support for Premiere Pro in 2024-2025:

## Current Status

On Dec 5th, 2024, Adobe opened their public beta for UXP Plugins in Premiere Pro.(no content)UXP in Premiere Pro has been in a private beta phase for a few months now, and developers can reach out to ppro-uxp-extensibility@adobe.com for pre-release access. The public beta launched in early December.

## CEP Status

CEP 12 shipped with Photoshop 25.12, Premiere Pro 25.0, and After Effects 25.0. CEP 12 will be the last major update to CEP, although critical security issues will continue to be addressed.(no content)CEP extensibility in Premiere Pro is "very definitely still supported, and there is no schedule for retiring it."(no content)Even once UXP is fully supported, Adobe will provide an overlapping period during which both mechanisms are supported; with the Flex to CEP transition, that was about 1.75 years of overlap. Adobe has "no plans to decommission support for CEP, without first allowing for a significant overlap period."

## UXP Timeline

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so through September 2026.(no content)The current plan is to officially release UXP extensibility, approaching 1:1 parity, in calendar year 2025; perhaps even summer 2025.(no content)The majority of what was possible via CEP+ExtendScript is now possible using UXP.

## Key Differences

CEP relies on the Chromium Embedded Framework, consuming significant system resources. UXP is a lightweight JavaScript engine built directly into Adobe apps, ensuring faster load times and lower memory usage.(no content)UXP plugins panels are the new way for 3rd party developers to build plugin panels in Adobe applications in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. UXP plugin panels will gradually replace CEP Extensions in Adobe apps on different timelines.

## Recommendation for Developers

If you plan on releasing soon, CEP is still recommended. If you don't plan on releasing soon, then probably UXP. The reality is if you're building a new tool that you plan to ship in the near future, CEP is still the best way to do this.(no content)All CEP panels will have to be migrated to UXP at some point in the future. Testing UXP for how you'll need to use it and providing feedback now will ensure that when CEP starts getting phased out, you're not stuck waiting on a bug fix or new feature from Adobe to complete your migration.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

## Current Status

Web search results for query: "Premiere Pro ExtendScript app.project.activeSequence timeline editing API documentation"

Links: [{"title":"Solved: Editing clips with ExtendScript - Adobe Product Community - 9056625","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro/editing-clips-with-extendscript/td-p/9056625"},{"title":"Samples/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx at master · Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx"},{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"Using Adobe ExtendScript to Automate Video Editing in Premiere Pro","url":"https://metadesignsolutions.com/using-adobe-extendscript-to-automate-video-editing-in-premiere-pro/"},{"title":"Solved: Re: Premiere Pro Scripting ExtendScript question - Adobe Support Community - 13379442","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/premiere-pro-scripting-extendscript-question/m-p/13380994"},{"title":"Re: How to export an EDL from a timeline using ExtendScript","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/how-to-export-an-edl-from-a-timeline-using-extendscript/m-p/9721602"},{"title":"Having fun with the Active Sequence, Mute Tracks, Place Clips - PremiereOnScript","url":"https://premiereonscript.com/log-11/"},{"title":"GitHub - ibrahimsaber1/PremierePro-Console: A JavaScript console extension for Adobe Premiere Pro that allows you to execute ExtendScript commands directly within Premiere Pro and view their results in real-time.","url":"https://github.com/ibrahimsaber1/PremierePro-Console"},{"title":"Solved: Selected clip in timeline? - Adobe Product Community - 8233928","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/selected-clip-in-timeline/td-p/8233928"},{"title":"Solved: Premiere Pro Scripting ExtendScript question - Adobe Product Community - 13379442","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/premiere-pro-scripting-extendscript-question/td-p/13379442"}]

Based on the search results, here's information about the Premiere Pro ExtendScript `app.project.activeSequence` timeline editing API:

## Premiere Pro ExtendScript Timeline API Documentation

### Key Resources

"Premiere Pro's ExtendScript-based API allows for broad control of the entire application. ExtendScript can access and manipulate most project elements, including metadata, exporting and rendering options."(no content)As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so through September 2026.

### Active Sequence Methods

**Working with Tracks and Clips:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.videoTracks[x].insertClip(clip, timecode in seconds)` - Inserts a clip at the specified time and shifts existing clips.
- `app.project.activeSequence.videoTracks[x].overwriteClip(clip, timecode in seconds)` - Overwrites whatever was there before without shifting anything.

**Player Position:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.getPlayerPosition()` returns the current playhead position. Use `.seconds` to convert from ticks to seconds.

**Work Area:**
- `seq.getWorkAreaInPointAsTime()` and `seq.getWorkAreaOutPointAsTime()` for getting work area boundaries, and `seq.setWorkAreaInPoint()` / `seq.setWorkAreaOutPoint()` for setting them.

**Markers:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.markers.getFirstMarker()` - Both Project items and sequences have associated Marker objects. Access marker comments via `.comments` property.
- `app.project.activeSequence.setPlayerPosition()` to set playhead position and `app.project.activeSequence.markers.createMarker(1)` to add markers.

**Export Functions:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.exportAsFinalCutProXML(fullPathToOutputFile, 1)`, `exportFramePNG(time, fullPathToOutputFile)`, `exportAsProject(fullPathToOutputFile)`, and `exportAsMediaDirect(fullPathToOutputFile, outPreset.fsName, appencoder.ENCODE_WORKAREA)`.

**Selection:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.getSelection()` returns currently-selected clips as an Array of trackItems. Combined with `app.bind`, you can get real-time events of selection changes.
- You can loop through a trackItemCollection and check for the `isSelected()` property. It returns a boolean, and if true, you can get both inPoint and outPoint from the trackItem.

**Iterating Clips:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.videoTracks[0 thru numTracks].clips[0 thru numClips]` with properties like `["name","inPoint","outPoint","start","end"]`.

### Limitations

"Mimicking in-timeline editing is not possible through ExtendScript as of today, but you can try to mimic classical 3-point editing."(no content)Regarding making cuts on the timeline: "ExtendScript can already add, remove, and change any trackItem" - but directly splitting a clip in two based on playhead position "using ExtendScript at present seems unsupported."(no content)No further changes to ExtendScript API are planned or scheduled; Adobe is focused on getting UXP extensibility to 1:1 parity with what's possible via CEP+ExtendScript.

### Documentation Sources

- **Official Scripting Guide**: https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/
- **Adobe CEP Samples (GitHub)**: https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on the search results, here's information about the Premiere Pro ExtendScript `app.project.activeSequence` timeline editing API:

## Premiere Pro ExtendScript Timeline API Documentation

### Key Resources

"Premiere Pro's ExtendScript-based API allows for broad control of the entire application. ExtendScript can access and manipulate most project elements, including metadata, exporting and rendering options."(no content)As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so through September 2026.

### Active Sequence Methods

**Working with Tracks and Clips:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.videoTracks[x].insertClip(clip, timecode in seconds)` - Inserts a clip at the specified time and shifts existing clips.
- `app.project.activeSequence.videoTracks[x].overwriteClip(clip, timecode in seconds)` - Overwrites whatever was there before without shifting anything.

**Player Position:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.getPlayerPosition()` returns the current playhead position. Use `.seconds` to convert from ticks to seconds.

**Work Area:**
- `seq.getWorkAreaInPointAsTime()` and `seq.getWorkAreaOutPointAsTime()` for getting work area boundaries, and `seq.setWorkAreaInPoint()` / `seq.setWorkAreaOutPoint()` for setting them.

**Markers:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.markers.getFirstMarker()` - Both Project items and sequences have associated Marker objects. Access marker comments via `.comments` property.
- `app.project.activeSequence.setPlayerPosition()` to set playhead position and `app.project.activeSequence.markers.createMarker(1)` to add markers.

**Export Functions:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.exportAsFinalCutProXML(fullPathToOutputFile, 1)`, `exportFramePNG(time, fullPathToOutputFile)`, `exportAsProject(fullPathToOutputFile)`, and `exportAsMediaDirect(fullPathToOutputFile, outPreset.fsName, appencoder.ENCODE_WORKAREA)`.

**Selection:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.getSelection()` returns currently-selected clips as an Array of trackItems. Combined with `app.bind`, you can get real-time events of selection changes.
- You can loop through a trackItemCollection and check for the `isSelected()` property. It returns a boolean, and if true, you can get both inPoint and outPoint from the trackItem.

**Iterating Clips:**
- `app.project.activeSequence.videoTracks[0 thru numTracks].clips[0 thru numClips]` with properties like `["name","inPoint","outPoint","start","end"]`.

### Limitations

"Mimicking in-timeline editing is not possible through ExtendScript as of today, but you can try to mimic classical 3-point editing."(no content)Regarding making cuts on the timeline: "ExtendScript can already add, remove, and change any trackItem" - but directly splitting a clip in two based on playhead position "using ExtendScript at present seems unsupported."(no content)No further changes to ExtendScript API are planned or scheduled; Adobe is focused on getting UXP extensibility to 1:1 parity with what's possible via CEP+ExtendScript.

### Documentation Sources

- **Official Scripting Guide**: https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/
- **Adobe CEP Samples (GitHub)**: https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx

input.prompt: Extract all available documentation sections, sequence object methods, track methods, and clip manipulation APIs

content.content:
# Premiere Pro Scripting Guide - Documentation Overview

## Available Documentation Sections

The guide organizes content into these main categories:

- **Introduction**: ExtendScript overview, changelog, and execution methods
- **Application**: Application object reference
- **General**: Anywhere, Encoder, Marker, Metadata, Production, Project, ProjectManager, Properties, and SourceMonitor objects
- **Item**: ProjectItem and TrackItem objects
- **Sequence**: Component, ComponentParam, Sequence, and Track objects
- **Other**: AudioChannelMapping and Time objects
- **Collection**: Eight collection types including ProjectItemCollection, SequenceCollection, and TrackItemCollection

## Sequence Object Methods

The documentation references a "Sequence object" within the Sequence section, though specific methods aren't detailed in this excerpt.

## Track Methods

Similarly, "Track object" is listed under the Sequence category, but individual methods aren't enumerated here.

## Clip Manipulation APIs

"TrackItem object" is documented under the Item section, which likely handles clip-level operations, though specific manipulation methods aren't provided in this content sample.

## Key Note

The guide states: *"As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP; Unified Extensibility Platform."* ExtendScript remains supported through September 2026.

For detailed method signatures and parameters, you'd need to access the individual object documentation pages linked in this guide's navigation structure.

Links: [{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"Solved: Editing clips with ExtendScript - Adobe Product Community - 9056625","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro/editing-clips-with-extendscript/td-p/9056625"},{"title":"Samples/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx at master · Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx"},{"title":"Sequence object - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/sequence/sequence/"},{"title":"Solved: Premiere to media encoder with extendscript - Adobe Product Community - 9804646","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/premiere-to-media-encoder-with-extendscript/td-p/9804646"},{"title":"Solved: Perform a cut from script? - Adobe Product Community - 11389974","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/perform-a-cut-from-script/td-p/11389974"},{"title":"How to Nest a Sequence using ExtendScript in Premiere Pro","url":"https://vakago-tools.com/how-to-nest-a-sequence-using-extendscript-in-premiere-pro/"},{"title":"Solved: ExtendScript: Split clip using insertClip method? - Adobe Product Community - 14432687","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/extendscript-split-clip-using-insertclip-method/m-p/14432687"},{"title":"Scripting bug when setInPoint and setOutPoint? - Adobe Premiere Pro - Creative COW","url":"https://creativecow.net/forums/thread/scripting-bug-when-setinpoint-and-setoutpointae/"},{"title":"Solved: Premiere Pro Scripting ExtendScript question - Adobe Product Community - 13379442","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/premiere-pro-scripting-extendscript-question/td-p/13379442"}]

Based on my search results, here's what I found about ExtendScript TrackItem manipulation for splitting clips in Premiere Pro:

## Key Findings

### TrackItem Properties for In/Out Points

The in point set on the source for this trackItem instance is relative to the beginning of the source. It's a Time object that is read/write.(no content)The out point set on the source for this TrackItem instance is relative to the beginning of the source. It's also a Time object that is read/write.

### No Direct Cut/Split Function

There's no such thing as a 'cut', in the API. Instead, you would adjust the duration of the existing trackItem, then insert a new trackItem, representing the remaining portion of the original trackItem.(no content)There's no cut function; you'd need to change the end point of the trackItem (clip).

### Workarounds for Splitting Clips

As a workaround you can use overwriteClip() with one-frame media and then delete that new media immediately, so you will have two desired cut clips but with a one-frame gap. Another workaround is adjusting inPoint, outPoint, start and end, but it is a bit tricky: clip's inPoint and outPoint work in a strange nonobvious way, so make tests first.

### QE DOM Razor Method

After a long time of searching, one user found it was about calling the RAZOR method using the QE (Quality Engineering) library: "app.enableQE(); var sqe = qe.project.getActiveSequence(); var playerTime = sqe.CTI.timecode;" - QE has a razor method that can be called on a sequence object.(no content)There's no cut function in extendscript API. QE DOM has razor(string, bool, bool) method on sequence and track objects but one user reported failing to get it to work.

### setInPoint/setOutPoint on Sequences (Not TrackItems)

setInPoint() is not a function to be used with videoTracks.clips. Any hints on manipulating the clip inPoints and outPoints would be appreciated.

The sequence-level `setInPoint()` and `setOutPoint()` methods work on the sequence object itself, as shown in the Adobe sample code for creating subsequences and exporting.

### Sample Code for Modifying TrackItem End Point

Example code shows: "var myClip = app.project.sequences[0].videoTracks[0].clips[0]; if (myClip){ var oldEnd = myClip.end; if (oldEnd){ oldEnd.seconds = oldEnd.seconds + 3; myClip.end = oldEnd; } }"


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

input.prompt: Extract all Sequence object methods, properties, and their descriptions including any for timeline editing, track manipulation, and clip operations
Extract the QE API documentation including razor method, sequence methods, and all available QE DOM functions for clip manipulation

content.content:
# Adobe Premiere Pro QE API Documentation

## Overview

The QE API (Quality Engineering) is an undocumented but widely-used interface for Premiere Pro plugin development. While originally built for Adobe's internal testing, it's now accessible to developers and enables features unavailable through the official API.

## Enabling the QE API

To use QE functionality, you must first call:
```javascript
app.enableQE();
```

Once enabled, you can access functions like `qe.newProject()` and interact with the QE DOM.

## Key QE Classes & Methods

### QE Class Properties
- `audioChannelMapping` (Number)
- `project` (Object)
- `version` (String)
- `language` (String)
- `platform` (String)

### QE Class Methods
Common methods include:
- `newProject(String)` - Create new project
- `open(String, Boolean)` - Open existing project
- `resetProject()` - Reset current project
- `getSequencePresets()` - Retrieve sequence presets
- `startPlayback()` / `stopPlayback()` - Control playback
- `wait(Number)` - Pause execution

## Clip Manipulation

### Apply Video Effects
```javascript
var effect = qe.project.getVideoEffectByName("Gamma Correction");
var sequence = qe.project.getActiveSequence();
var clip = sequence.getVideoTrackAt(0).getItemAt(1);
clip.addVideoEffect(effect);
```

### Get Available Effects
- `qe.project.getVideoEffectList()` - Lists all available video effects

## Additional QE Features

- **Undo**: `qe.project.undo()` - Undo specific actions
- **Project inspection**: Access active sequences and track items
- **Performance logging**: `enablePerformanceLogging()`, `disablePerformanceLogging()`

## Discovery Tool

The **ExtendScript Developer Tools** extension provides "a list of all properties and methods including respective parameters and return types," making QE API exploration easier than manual reflection calls.

toolUseResult.result:
# Adobe Premiere Pro QE API Documentation

## Overview

The QE API (Quality Engineering) is an undocumented but widely-used interface for Premiere Pro plugin development. While originally built for Adobe's internal testing, it's now accessible to developers and enables features unavailable through the official API.

## Enabling the QE API

To use QE functionality, you must first call:
```javascript
app.enableQE();
```

Once enabled, you can access functions like `qe.newProject()` and interact with the QE DOM.

## Key QE Classes & Methods

### QE Class Properties
- `audioChannelMapping` (Number)
- `project` (Object)
- `version` (String)
- `language` (String)
- `platform` (String)

### QE Class Methods
Common methods include:
- `newProject(String)` - Create new project
- `open(String, Boolean)` - Open existing project
- `resetProject()` - Reset current project
- `getSequencePresets()` - Retrieve sequence presets
- `startPlayback()` / `stopPlayback()` - Control playback
- `wait(Number)` - Pause execution

## Clip Manipulation

### Apply Video Effects
```javascript
var effect = qe.project.getVideoEffectByName("Gamma Correction");
var sequence = qe.project.getActiveSequence();
var clip = sequence.getVideoTrackAt(0).getItemAt(1);
clip.addVideoEffect(effect);
```

### Get Available Effects
- `qe.project.getVideoEffectList()` - Lists all available video effects

## Additional QE Features

- **Undo**: `qe.project.undo()` - Undo specific actions
- **Project inspection**: Access active sequences and track items
- **Performance logging**: `enablePerformanceLogging()`, `disablePerformanceLogging()`

## Discovery Tool

The **ExtendScript Developer Tools** extension provides "a list of all properties and methods including respective parameters and return types," making QE API exploration easier than manual reflection calls.

content.content:
# Sequence Object Methods and Properties

## Properties (Attributes)

The Sequence object contains the following read/write and read-only properties:

| Property | Type | Description |
|----------|------|-------------|
| `audioDisplayFormat` | Enum | "The audio display format of the sequence" (Audio Samples or Milliseconds) |
| `audioTracks` | TrackCollection | Array of audio Track objects in the sequence |
| `end` | String | Time in ticks marking sequence conclusion |
| `frameSizeHorizontal` | Integer | Width of the sequence frame |
| `frameSizeVertical` | Integer | Height of the sequence frame |
| `id` | Integer | Ordinal assigned upon creation (noted as unstable) |
| `markers` | MarkerCollection | Array of Marker objects in sequence |
| `name` | String | Sequence identifier (read/write) |
| `projectItem` | ProjectItem | Associated ProjectItem object |
| `sequenceID` | String | Unique identifier in UUID format |
| `timebase` | String | Ticks per frame; defines frame duration |
| `videoDisplayFormat` | Enum | Display format (timecode, frames, film feet variants) |
| `videoTracks` | TrackCollection | Array of video Track objects |
| `zeroPoint` | String | Starting time in ticks (read/write via method) |

## Methods - Playback & Position Control

- `getPlayerPosition()` - "Retrieves the position of the CTI (Current Time Indicator), in ticks"
- `setPlayerPosition(time)` - Moves playhead to specified time
- `getInPoint()` / `getInPointAsTime()` - Retrieves sequence in point
- `setInPoint(time)` - Establishes new in point
- `getOutPoint()` / `getOutPointAsTime()` - Retrieves sequence out point
- `setOutPoint(time)` - Establishes new out point
- `setZeroPoint(newZeroPoint)` - "Set the starting time of the sequence"

## Methods - Work Area Management

- `getWorkAreaInPoint()` / `getWorkAreaInPointAsTime()` - Retrieves work area start
- `setWorkAreaInPoint(time)` - Sets work area beginning
- `getWorkAreaOutPoint()` / `getWorkAreaOutPointAsTime()` - Retrieves work area end
- `setWorkAreaOutPoint(time)` - Sets work area conclusion
- `isWorkAreaEnabled()` - Returns whether work area bar is active

## Methods - Clip Operations

- `insertClip(projectItem, time, vTrackIndex, aTrackIndex)` - "Inserts a clip into the sequence, on the specified video and audio tracks"
- `overwriteClip(projectItem, time, vTrackIndex, aTrackIndex)` - Inserts while replacing existing content
- `getSelection()` - "An array of Track item objects, of the selected clips in the sequence"
- `linkSelection()` - Connects selected video and audio clips
- `unlinkSelection()` - Separates selected linked clips

## Methods - Track Management

- `createSubsequence([ignoreTrackTargeting])` - "Creates a new sequence, from the in point to the out point, which is a sub-sequence"
- `createCaptionTrack(projectItem, startAtTime, [captionFormat])` - Adds caption track from source

## Methods - Effects & Analysis

- `isDoneAnalyzingForVideoEffects()` - Reports completion status of effect analysis
- `performSceneEditDetectionOnSelection(actionDesired, applyCutsToLinkedAudio, sensitivity)` - Detects scene cuts

## Methods - Template & Media Import

- `importMGT(path, time, vidTrackOffset, audTrackOffset)` - "Imports a MOGRT, or an After Effects Motion Graphics Template"
- `importMGTFromLibrary(libraryName, mgtName, time, vidTrackOffset, audTrackOffset)` - Imports templates from Creative Cloud Libraries

## Methods - Sequence Configuration

- `getSettings()` - Retrieves comprehensive sequence settings structure
- `setSettings(sequenceSettings)` - Applies settings modifications
- `autoReframeSequence(numerator, denominator, motionPreset, newName, useNestedSequences)` - "Generates a new, auto-reframed sequence"

## Methods - Export & Project Operations

- `exportAsFinalCutProXML(outputPath)` - Creates FCP XML file representation
- `exportAsMediaDirect(outputPath, presetPath, workAreaType)` - Renders sequence to specified output
- `exportAsProject(outputPath)` - "Creates a new Project object containing only the given sequence"
- `getExportFileExtension(outputPresetPath)` - Determines file extension from preset

## Methods - Sequence Management

- `clone()` - Creates duplicate sequence
- `close()` - Closes active sequence
- `attachCustomProperty(propertyID, propertyValue)` - "Attaches a custom property, and its value, to the sequence"

## Methods - Export & Project Operations

## Methods - Sequence Management

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Premiere Pro UXP API timeline editing cut split clips 2024 2025"

Links: [{"title":"Request for Timeline Editing API Support (Clip Tra... - Adobe Product Community - 15624626","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-ideas/request-for-timeline-editing-api-support-clip-track-movement-flattening/idc-p/15625115"},{"title":"The Premiere UXP API","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/"},{"title":"How to Add Clips to a Sequence Using Premiere Pro UXP API? - Premiere Pro - Adobe Creative Cloud Developer Forums","url":"https://forums.creativeclouddeveloper.com/t/how-to-add-clips-to-a-sequence-using-premiere-pro-uxp-api/8977"},{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"UXP: How to read clip markers and cut timeline ite... - Adobe Product Community - 15510061","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/uxp-how-to-read-clip-markers-and-cut-timeline-items-at-those-positions/td-p/15510061"},{"title":"Premiere and UXP","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/introduction/"},{"title":"Premiere API","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/"},{"title":"GitHub - AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples"},{"title":"Solved: how to insertClip in UXP plugin - Adobe Product Community - 15097904","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/how-to-insertclip-in-uxp-plugin/td-p/15097904"},{"title":"Premiere Pro UXP Beta — Blog | Hyper Brew","url":"https://hyperbrew.co/blog/premiere-pro-uxp-beta/"}]

Based on my search results, here's what I found about Premiere Pro UXP API timeline editing capabilities for cutting and splitting clips in 2024-2025:

## Premiere Pro UXP API - Timeline Editing Status

### Current State of UXP in Premiere Pro

On Dec 5th, 2024, Adobe opened their public beta for UXP Plugins in Premiere Pro.(no content)UXP is the current extensibility standard for Adobe Creative Cloud applications, supported by a constantly growing set of applications, including Premiere (version 25.6), Photoshop, and InDesign.(no content)UXP (Unified eXtensibility Platform) is an integration framework built into Premiere and other Adobe Creative Cloud applications. It is powered by a modern JavaScript engine and offers the ability to access many Premiere functions at a programmatic level.

### Timeline Editing API Limitations

"UXP in Premiere Pro is in beta and very very new so lots of APIs haven't been built yet."(no content)If you need a production panel today or in the near future, you're going to need to build it in CEP.(no content)There is no current API method (DOM, QE, CEP, or UXP) that can move an existing clip vertically between tracks.(no content)However, in current Premiere Pro builds (2023–2025), this function appears to exist in the QE object model but is not operational.(no content)The 'premiere_api' UXP example plugin, the right starting point for any future integrations, shows how to clone and remove track items.

### Key Technical Details

An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous. This means they blocked the Premiere UI while they were executing. In UXP, a method call is asynchronous, and does not block the UI thread. For a smooth transition between the ExtendScript DOM and the UXP DOM, all properties (get and set) in the API were designed to be synchronous and do not need to be awaited.

### Migration Timeline

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP; Unified Extensibility Platform. ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so, through September 2026.

### Resources

- **Official UXP API Documentation**: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/
- **Sample Plugins**: The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available here: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/.
- **UXP Developer Forums**: https://forums.creativeclouddeveloper.com/c/uxp-for-premiere-pro/105

### Summary

The UXP API for Premiere Pro is still relatively new and has limited timeline editing capabilities. While basic operations like cloning and removing track items are supported, more advanced functions like cutting/splitting clips at specific positions or moving clips between tracks are either not yet implemented or not fully functional. For production-ready timeline manipulation, CEP with ExtendScript remains the recommended approach until the UXP API matures further.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

input.prompt: Extract all available UXP API methods for Premiere Pro including sequence, track, and clip manipulation APIs
List all timeline, sequence, track, and clip methods available in the UXP API
